scenario_text.value: I mean, that’s just... Y’know?
Yes, it’s a bit...
Tch...
Um, hrmm...

(This is bad... Everyone sympathizing with
them and forgetting our goal!)

Guys! We know for sure that the shrine is in
the area they’re protecting!
We’ve got to get to that shrine!
Even if you say that...

Those guys will fly at us they second they
spot us.

Still, I’d feel ashamed to have to smack them
down.

(Uh oh, now they’re all losing motivation!
Gotta do something before it’s too late!)
...Okay, I’ve got it.
I could act as a decoy to draw them away.

Shuuji...?! Come on, man, that’s just too
reckless.

We’ll make two teams: one as a diversion, the
other to search for the Holy Beast.

While the diversion team keeps the enemy
busy, the other team locates the target.

Don’t worry, the decoy won’t fight. I’ll just
run away. Easy-peasy.
But Shuuji, letting you do that alone is—
In that case, I’ll join the decoy team!
Minoru?!

Don’t worry, man! We’ll just be running,
right? Piece of cake!
I’d be fine on my own, you know.

What?! This isn’t something you should have
to do alone, even if it’s just running away!
We’re friends, man!

Besides, I’m not the only one on board!
Right, Ryo?

Don’t just draft me whenever you feel like
it!

If two heads are better than one, with three
heads we can’t lose! C’mon, man!
...Jeez, fine.
I’m not sure that’s how that saying works...

Still, I appreciate the help. I know it’s my
suggestion, but I am kinda nervous.
Why didn’t you say so in the first place!?

I couldn’t just rope you in, now could I?
Anyway, the diversion team is picked.
Time to lure away the enemy!
Wait, now hold on—
Hey, who’re you?!
Awesome, here they come!

Run! We’ll split up at a certain point and
regroup with the others!
If everything goes well, you mean...
